data.title: Nothing Fancy. Just Good Food!
data.text: This place seems like its been here forever- and I had never gone into it. What a mistake on my part. I finally gave it a shot based largely on the reviews I had seen on Tripadvisor. I was stopped at a traffic light just outside Establos, when I noticed a constant stream of people going inside. So i decided to pull over and give it a try. Glad I did. Excellent carnitas burrito for $5. This is a little market that has a small kitchen that cooks up Mexican food. I can only comment on the Burrito I got, but as I said it was excellent. You need to order at the register up front, then take your number back to kitchen area. They call out your number when it's ready. There are a few tables and chairs to eat inside if you want to, but most people seem to get their orders to go. It's nothing fancy by any means. But the food is what it's all about.

data.title: Great food reasonably priced.
data.text: I have been eating at Establos for years. I have tried most of the menu and I love this place. The burritos, tacos and tortas are all completely legit and fully loaded with fresh ingredients and tasty meat. The horchata is top notch. The market has any spices and herbs you need for a reasonable price. Try this place out.

data.title: Authenic Mexican Food
data.text: Establos offers true authentic Mexican food.   The food choices offered are complete for any tastes, beer, pork, chicken, fish and vegetarian as well.  Not only do they offer food to dine in, there is a market with very reasonable prices and a nice selection from the butcher counter,  While the food has to be ordered at the front of the store and can be a bit confusing on the first try around, it is well worth the wait.  The orders are processed quickly and can be ordered for there or to go.

data.title: Only Authentic you'll find in TOWN!
data.text: I love it here we've been returning for 2 years now!! great little market with a sit down area to eat and it has a liquor license so you can buy a beer and drink while you enjoy delicious authentic Mexican food!!!

data.title: Second review to talk about the sopas
data.text: So they have vegetarian sopas that are just out of this world.  But even better, I asked them to make me a torta without the meat and with guac.  Like the best pressed hot sandwich in town.  This place is excellent.  I guess the only problem is the setup is such that it only takes a few people to make the line long, and there really isn't very much seating.

data.title: Lil' Mexico
data.text: I finally stopped in to check out this grocery/deli joint.  Didn't buy food from the counter but my daughter and I had fun looking around at the items as they carry brands not typical in our grocery stores. It was not crowded as it was around 7:30 at night, friendly employees. Can't wait to come again, hungry, and eat their traditional Mexican food!

data.title: Long wait, no complementary water.  Food is authentic, decent and inexpensive
data.text: The restaurant has an authentic Mexican ambiance.  It is also relatively inexpensively. However, there is a long wait.  You first wait in line to order and pay.  Then, you wait for them to call your number.  I waited for about 20 minutes.  They do not serve complementary water.  That's a big negative in my book.  Also, there is only one bathroom at this restaurant.  The dining area is cramped.  The food was decent.  My burrito was only OK.

data.title: If you want it Authentic, Fast and Inexpensive....
data.text:
Establos is one my favorite places in town.  It is the most authentic place for real Mexican food that tastes home made.  It is where I go for comfort food.....my diet goes out the window but my taste buds and tummy are always happy.  

Establos is usually very quick.  I can call them on my way home from work, swing by to pick up my food & not miss a beat.  The fact that it is next door to Rocket Fizz is a plus too, so I can go there to get something interesting to drink with my meal..

It's a meat market, so don't expect fancy but it is always good.  My go-to dish there is not for the faint of heart, but if you are up to it try the lengua quesadillas.  Yes, it is beef tongue and it's served with sour cream, a guacamole sauce and some grilled onions and peppers.  It is quite large and I could easily get a couple of meals from it plus have some to share with my dog :-).

data.title: Authentic...Authentic....Authentic
data.text:
Great market and deli. 
The vast menu is a mix I'm English and Spanish and the lady at the counter was helpful translating the menu
Try the Shrimp Quesadilla!

data.title: Cheap and Easy
data.text: Cheap tasty simple tacos, burritos and tortas cooked next to the meat department in a Mexican grocery store. Tasty little $1. Tacos, Good tortas and all meat burritos in a casual local market. The pork, chicken and beef ALL taste the same

data.title: Very Authentic, Fresh and Tasty
data.text:
A friend recommended this place to me.  I had seen it a few times when I was headed to catch a train across the street.  It was good!  My husband and I had food and a soft drink, and I took food home for $14.  He had the chili rellenos and I had a quesadilla with carne asada.  Each came with the trimming of salsa, lime and radishes, plus tortillas for his meal.  The cashier was really nice & patient with me as there were a couple of type of meat on the menu that I wasn't familiar with.  She was very kind as she explained what everything was.  They had quite a variety of dishes and meats.  

We decided to have the full experience of eating there under the pinatas.  That was a little different, if you're not used to it.  But is was just part of the ambiance - it was easy to forget we were in Camarillo while we dined there.    We will go back for fresh, authentic Mexican food at very reasonable prices.

data.title: Real deal
data.text: I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant in Camarillo.  Not a restaurant as much as it is a grocery store.  Thats not what surprised me though.  The fact that I am a vegetarian and this is a butcher shop did.  Order at the register by the door.  The menu is above.  Lots to choose from, even some vegetarian options.  Take you ticket to the guys in the back and soon you will be treated to some good food. You can eat in the seating area up front or take your order to go.  I gotta believe the meat dishes are good too.  I'll be back.

data.title: Worth a stop!!
data.text: I have brought several people here... 1st for an amazing burrito, then to buy items to bring home! A great full service meat counter, homemade salsa & Outstanding customer Service! A+

data.title: Fantastic, authentic Mexican.
data.text: Found this place by accident waiting for the train to San Diego.  My GOD....it is so good.  I'm glad I don't live nearby...I'd be broke!  Had a breakfast burrito with chourico, potatoes, eggs, the works.  They serve with your choice of sauce, lime and radish.  It cost $4.25 and is HUGE!  It lasted me all day!  Great meat counter in the back.  Three guys on the grill.  I bought of bunch of different dried chilies to bring home.  So....so....so good!

data.title: Cheap but very good burrito
data.text: If you want cheap and good burrito I suggest you go to Establos.  Their burritos are cheap I get two with all the fixings for less than 10 bucks. I always get the Chicharon burrito cuz I like the crunchiness.  Tip: calll in advance cuz the wait is sometimes long -establos is a mini mexican grocery store.

data.title: Authentic Delicious Mexican food.
data.text: This is a hidden treasure. Its one of those "hole in the wall" places thay delivers tasty,well seasoned .yummy mexican food. This is as culturally accurate as it gets. Most of the food is great..the burritos are varied and large in size...rice and beans...tacos..great. the red salsa is spicy and hot ..the green sauce has the perfect balance of tomatillos.lemon ..cilantro.jalapenos. .yum. my favorite treat here is the open faced corn tortilla chicken tacos. A small packet of grilled onions.jalapenos and cut lime is a thoughtful add on. Some other advantages is the fresh very inexpensive produce and perfectly clean beautiful meat market. My only downside..,is the way you have to get your food. You pay up front ..then go to the cooking area where your food is prepared while you wait. The great part ? The food is very low priced. My tip...go on off times so you have a short wait. Good eats!

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: Meat market atmosphere is a little strange but they have sitting in the room next door.   Burrito's are huge and very affordable.     Al Pastor taco's were excellent.  My husband had tripes taco's and he loved them.  We had a chile verde plate that was okay - not spicy enough.     Tortas looked huge.   We will definitely be back.  The girl taking my order messed it up alittle but it wasn't too bad.   I only speak English not sure if that is why.   She put no tortilla's on our order for the Chile Verde plate and I asked for a flour toritlla, we said for here and she put it was to go.  I ordered a large Horchata and she charged me for a small.   Just little things.   We also bought some chicken to grill at home for the next day.  Was excellent.   We were driving home from outlet's and I found this place on Yelp.   I'm glad we stopped.  There is a neat candy store next door too.

data.title: Why did it take me so long to find this?
data.text:
I have lived in Camarillo for about a year and a half before I found this place. Before then I was going to Oxnard or Ventura for my Mexican food fix. I have had tacos, nachos and burritos there and all were delicious.

My only complaint is the staff there were super rude the few times they messed up my order and I asked them to fix it.

data.title: Excellent!!
data.text: I lived in town for a couple years before I found this hidden gem.  I love authentic Mexican tacos and finally had found them here.  Now it's a regular stop for me, I can’t get enough, the food is so delicious.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: This place is a favorite of my family in Camarillo. We stopped in for tacos and loved it. You order at the front cashier, and pick up your food at the meat counter in the back. There are a handful of tables in the produce section of the market if you want to eat in. If I lived nearby, I'd eat here regularly.
